title: Using self collision can cause Simbody to crash.

content.raw:
So I am trying to work around the lack of mesh support using hitboxes. Unfortunately, I cannot use the self collision tag without causing Gazebo to crash due to Simbody itself crashing (or getting stuck in a loop or something). I have attached the necessary world required to reproduce the results below.

Also: I get a lot of warnings from Simbody about not being able to set axis and other things, which is weird because I only use the SDF:

[Dbg] [SimbodyHingeJoint.cc:55] SetAxis: setting axis is not yet implemented.  The axis are set  during joint construction in SimbodyPhysics.cc for now.
[Err] [SimbodyJoint.cc:384] SimbodyJoint::SetAnchor:  Not implement in Simbody. Anchor is set during joint construction in SimbodyPhysics.cc

However, this does not cause the crash as setting self_collide to false allows the simulation to proceed just fine while still generating those error messages.
content.html:
So I am trying to work around the lack of mesh support using hitboxes. Unfortunately, I cannot use the self collision tag without causing Gazebo to crash due to Simbody itself crashing (or getting stuck in a loop or something). I have attached the necessary world required to reproduce the results below.

Also: I get a lot of warnings from Simbody about not being able to set axis and other things, which is weird because I only use the SDF:

[Dbg] [SimbodyHingeJoint.cc:55] SetAxis: setting axis is not yet implemented. The axis are set during joint construction in SimbodyPhysics.cc for now. [Err] [SimbodyJoint.cc:384] SimbodyJoint::SetAnchor: Not implement in Simbody. Anchor is set during joint construction in SimbodyPhysics.cc

However, this does not cause the crash as setting self_collide to false allows the simulation to proceed just fine while still generating those error messages.
